page.title: 12Farming around Cattistock
page.content: A farming area, mostly grassland, for seven dairies - average 100, mainly Friesians; six flocks of sheep: Scotch, Half-bred, Dorset Horn and Crossbreds; six farms for beef fattening and stores - Herefords, Charolais, Aberdeen Angus; also dairy and beef replacement. Goats, horses and poultry. Grass cut for silage and hay, crops corn and kale. Straw baled for bedding and feeding. Milk collected by refrigerated tankers. Auction markets for cattle and sheep at Yeovil, Sturminster Newton, Dorchester. Labour force minimal, high technological machinery or husband and wife teams. Compulsory yearly dipping of sheep against sheep scab. Cattle treatment for eradication of warble flies. Some downland too steep for ploughing.
